full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 773 Filed 08/10/22 Page 2 of 29 3119 LCRVMAXT

(Trial resumed; jury not present)
THE COURT: I did receive a note.
May we please have the following items: Different colored Post-Its; white paperboard; highlighters, different colors; and then Matt's transcript; and then also may we have a definition of "enticement."
So we're going to get started on the supplies. We'll get them colored Post-Its, white paperboard. I'm not sure exactly what they mean but we'll try and find a large pad, and we'll also give them a whiteboard and dry erase markers and then highlighters.
Ms. Moe, Matt's transcript you'll get printed immediately?
MS. MOE: Yes, your Honor.
THE COURT: Okay. And then I'll hear from the parties as to how they would like to respond to the request for a definition of "enticement."
MS. MOE: Your Honor, with respect to the jury's question regarding enticement, our view is that the Court's instruction, which is on page 21, instruction number 15: "The terms persuaded, induced, enticed, and coerced have their ordinary everyday meanings." That remain true now, and so we would propose referring them to that portion of the Court's instruction.
MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor?
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00014688
